ext_descriptions.ext_description: The document_category enumeration provides classification information of a document.

ext_description.p: the assigned document is the catalogue in which the associated object is listed;
ext_description.example: The document can be the catalogue of the manufacturer.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the assigned document is the handbook that is supplied for the associated object;
the assigned document specifies the considerations that lead to the design finally chosen for the associated object.

The part_category enumeration provides high level classification information.
When new enumeration values are added to this enumeration, they should be of general classifying nature. A part_category should not be used to classify object names or identifiers. For user defined classes and classification of items that share common properties,
and
should be used.

ext_description.p: this type of classification is used to indicate that a part shall be considered under certification aspects;
ext_description.example: Prior to the release of a new car to the market, both function and quality of certain parts have to be certified by an authority, e.g., the department of transportation. For such item objects, certification requirements have to be considered during the design phase.

ext_description.p:
this type of classification shall be used for any part that has an
provided for at least one of its versions, i.e., it is decomposed further;

this type of classification shall be used for any part that has a
provided for at least one of its versions;
this type of classification is used to indicate that a part is used in a production site that has assembling facilities only;
ext_description.example: The 'completely knocked down' may indicate that the components are shipped to and assembled in a different country.

ext_description.p:
this type of classification shall be used for any part that has no
provided for any of its versions, i.e., it is not further decomposed;
this type of classification is used to indicate that the part identifies an intermediate object in a manufacturing process;
ext_description.note: Detailed information about the stage the part has within the manufacturing process may be obtained from the .

ext_description.p: this type of classification is used to indicate that the part identifies a prototype and is not intended for serial production;
the part plays the role of raw material;
the part plays the role of raw material, cut by length, e.g. cable;
the part plays the role of raw material, cut by area, e.g. chipboard;
the part plays the role of raw material, cut by volume, e.g. a raw block of marble;
this type of classification is used to indicate that for a part certain regulations have to be considered;
this type of classification is used to indicate that a part is relevant for safety purposes;
this type of classification is used to indicate that a part is relevant for service purposes;

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the part plays the role of a tool;

ext_description.p: the part plays the role of an inseparable assembly;
specifies the role of the boxed part;
ext_description.example: A can with one litre of a specific oil.

ext_description.p: this type of classification is used to indicate the part that can be measured by it's volume or weight;
this type of classification is used to indicate that a part is one single piece.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: A Document_with_additional_categories is a type of .

provides classification information. There shall exist at least one
for the Document_with_additional_categories.
A Part_with_additional_categories is a type of .

specifies the role of the
for the Part_with_additional_categories. There shall exist at least one
for the Part_with_additional_categories.
A Retention_period is the definition of a period of time that product data needs to be maintained due to organizational policy or legal requirements.
specifies the rationale behind the Retention_period. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the point in time after which any object the Retention_period is applied to may be deleted or destroyed. In this context deletion or destruction applies to all subordinate objects that are not referenced by other objects. The value of this attribute need not be specified.

specifies the point in time before which any objects that the Retention_period is applied to shall be deleted or destroyed. In this context deletion or destruction applies to all subordinate objects that are not used by other objects. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the point in time at which the Retention_period starts.

ext_description.p: specifies the objects whose existence is controlled by the Retention_period.
ext_description.note: The master document is the one for which earliest_end_definition and latest_end_definition are the same.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: There shall exist at least one of earliest_end_definition and latest_end_definition.

The product_occurrence_usage rule ensures that a
is used within a product structure.

A
shall either be used by a

The unique_document_id rule constrains the population of entity instances so that shall be unique within that population.
Constrains the population of entity instances so that shall be unique within that population.
The unique_part_id rule constrains the population of entity instances so that shall be unique within that population.
Constrains the population of entity instances so that shall be unique within that population.
The unique_product_version_id rule constrains the population of entity instances so that the of Product_versions that use same in role of shall be unique.
Constrains the population of entity instances so that the of Product_versions that use same in role of shall be unique.
The unique_product_view_definition_id rule constrains the population of entity instances so that the of Product_view_definitions that use same in role of shall be unique.
Constrains the population of entity instances so that the of Product_view_definitions that use same in role of shall be unique.
The unique_requirement_id rule constrains the population of entity instances so that shall be unique within that population.
Constrains the population of entity instances so that shall be unique within that population.
